content.description:
Sit start on the horizontal handcrack and the horn from

Jezabel's

heelhook, then go up trending left. The holds get better as you go, to an easy topout, so it is a nice problem for beginner boulderers and is more fun than it looks.
content.location:
Testing Temptation is to the left of

Jezabel's Heel

on the narrow face.

content.description: Begin with a short, overhung sit start on nice, flat edges, deadpoint to the edge, then use good footwork to get over the hump. Or use no footwork, and hump your way over - it's more entertaining for your companions.
content.location: It is on the side of the boulder facing the valley.

content.description: Sit start on the low, opposing handholds with awkward, leg-spreading foot holds. Shoot up to the crack, then finish on an easy, juggy topout.
content.location:
Find the beautiful orange face to the right of

Jezabel's Heel

.

content.description: Jezabel's Heel is a fantastic problem. Sit start with your hands in a crack (find the pocket inside) and seam with bad foot holds. Shoot to the amazing, slopey pocket, then work up the arete using heelhooks and small holds. Move up the arete, and follow it back to the right, through a good dish, and a topout that is not quite as easy as it looks. This has top notch movement.
content.location: Locate the overhanging face to the left of the orange streak.
